‡a Corporate name or jurisdiction name as entry element (NR) ‡b Subordinate unit (R) ‡c Location of meeting (NR) ‡d Date of meeting or treaty signing (R) ‡e Relator term (R) ‡f Date of work (NR) ‡g Miscellaneous information (NR) ‡h Medium (NR) ‡k Form subheading (R) ‡l Language of a work (NR) ‡m Medium of performance for music (R) ‡n Number of part/section of a work (R) ‡o Arranged statement for music (NR) ‡p Name of part/section of a work (R) ‡r Key for music (NR) ‡s Version (NR) ‡t Title of a work (NR) ‡u Affiliation (NR) ‡x International Standard Serial Number (NR) ‡3 Materials specified (NR) ‡4 Relator code (R) ‡5 Institution to which field applies (NR) ‡9 Special entry (NR)

Nonstandard corporate local added entries. Use for corporate local added entries not supported by cataloging rules (e.g., donor or gift information or variant form). See field 791 for definitions of indicators and subfields. Although defined for records migrated from the RLG Union Catalog, field 797 may be used by anyone. The choice of which field to use is up to users. Note: Subfield ‡9 is user-defined.
pageTitle: Technical Bulletin 254: OCLC-MARC Format Update 2007 and Institution Records to Accommodate the RLG Union Catalog

textBeforeTable: SpFm Special Format Characteristics (MAP 008/33-34; MAP 006/16-17) 2 Bibliographic Record Changes All RLG migrating libraries are authorized to create and maintain institution records. Existing OCLC cataloging members can order institution record creation and maintenance on July 1, 2007. The ability to work with institution records will be available in Connexion browser in late May 2007 and in Connexion client 2.0 in late June 2007. All OCLC member catalogers have read-only access to all institution records. With read-only access, you can retrieve, copy and paste, export, or print institution records. You can also derive bibliographic master records or bibliographic constant data records from IRs. If your OCLC cataloging profile (determined by your logon authorization) includes institution records, you can create, add, delete, move and take other actions on your own institution records. Otherwise, you have read-only access to the institution records of other libraries. Who can use institution records? Institution records contain additional cataloging data, including all local data, such as local call numbers, holdings locations within the institution, or local or copy-specific notes. Purpose of institution records The master record to which institution records correspond is identified in the IR by the master record OCLC number, which the system supplies in field 079 ‡a. Like bibliographic master records, bibliographic institution records are assigned unique OCLC control numbers in WorldCat. A new index (ir:) is available to search specifically for IR OCLC numbers.
